intro: Elleanthus cephalophorus, commonly known as the Cape goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, golden-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Elleanthus cephalophorus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
